title: minerjones
author: minerjones
content: I just completed the auction for this 0.5BTC Casascius silver coin here:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5468069.msg62926404#msg62926404Both I and the owner of the listed coin were engaged with notorious elements after the auction had ended.From fake forum PMs to fake emails using an unknown/fake email address.Based on the value of what could have been lost, I would like to state this:1) From now on, all auction/sales addresses will be listed in said thread... there will NEVER be a change to thisNo emails, Telegrams. Discords, forum PM, etc... the listed address will be the ONLY address for payment2) Any messages or PMs outside of this forum should be disregarded. This is the only place that transaction information will be accepted.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Outside communications like those on telegram are red flags. I think the more transparent things are, the safer they are and less risky for all involved. The more simple the better.

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: very good decision mj!in view of this approach, i would then add the following to the topic title: official list of payment addresses for completed auctions/sales or something like that

comments.author: StackItUp
comments.body: Thank you for letting know. I support this decision, it will be much more safe especially when trading high value items

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: Eclipse33 on October 02, 2023, 07:49:05 PMI just had a previous client of mine message me on eBay out of the blue asking why I was trying to take the sale off platform. I was not messaging this client previously. Turns out there is a scammer on eBay using my logo and pictures to try to bag my clients off platform. My client nearly fell for it and got taken off platform and bagged. I vote to put a headhunt on all scammers. Defend our commerce and marketplace from this filth. Perhaps the bitcointalk anti-scammer coalition. The problem with things like that are people will inevitably abuse them for extortion-like purposes. If you don’t believe that, just check my trust ratings…

comments.body: I want to suggets that important data like payment address and other relevant stuff should be signed with their bitcoin public address or with some signed PGP Public key.Those data must be stacked in some of the forum post with in some months or weeks:Stake your Bitcoin address hereThe BCT PGP/GPG Public Key Database: Stake Your PGP Key HereI know that this may be some difficult for some people, but at least most software wallet like electrum/sparrow can sign text messagess easily.At least with this you may notice that you are dealing with someone that knows what is he doing.
